layer5session.eli5: This layer is like a walkie-talkie call—it makes sure your conversation stays connected and organized.
layer5session.boss: The Session Layer (Layer 5) manages and maintains communication sessions between devices over a network.
layer5session.sysadmin: Layer 5 of the OSI model handles session setup, maintenance, and teardown. It ensures synchronized communication and stateful interactions.
layer5session.use_case: Used during remote desktop sessions to keep communication stable and recoverable.

layer6presentation.eli5: This layer is like a translator that helps computers speak each other’s language.
layer6presentation.boss: The Presentation Layer (Layer 6) ensures data is readable and formatted correctly between systems.
layer6presentation.sysadmin: Layer 6 manages data encoding, encryption, and compression so that application data is presented in a usable format.
layer6presentation.use_case: Used to decrypt HTTPS data before it reaches your browser’s display.

layer7application.eli5: Layer 7 is where your apps like email and browsers live—it’s the front door of the internet.
layer7application.boss: The Application Layer (Layer 7) interacts directly with end-user services like browsers, email, and file sharing apps.
layer7application.sysadmin: Layer 7 defines network services like HTTP, FTP, DNS, SMTP and allows APIs and client apps to access network functions.
layer7application.use_case: Used when you access websites, send email, or stream media over the internet.
